name: Box Gutter Installation
template name: Box Gutter Installation Checklist (New Roof Area)

name: Insulation under gutter: 60mm Box gutter insulation
Box gutter installed to sizes as shown in specification and drawings.
Sumps installed to correct locations and sizes as specified and as shown on drawings
Overflow outlets installed at each downpipe location and to correct size as indicated.
Rivet spacing for sump / box gutter are adequate
Rivet spacing for pop / sumps are adequate
Area clean and free of debris.
Inspected and accepted by S&H authorised representative as complying with relevant Australian Standard and legislation
Inspected and accepted by Authorized Representative
All items have been completed and demonstrated satisfactorily
Thermal spacer: 60mm thermal - Fletchers spacer Roof Razor
Insulation below box gutter lapped at joins
Area clean and free of debris
Materials in good condition with no tears
Inspected and accepted by S&H authorised representative as complying with relevant Australian Standard and legislation
Inspected and accepted by Authorized Representative
All items have been completed and demonstrated satisfactorily
Roof Screws: Screws to suit profile
Roof installed with adequate fall to meet roof profile
Roof installed straight and perpendicular to Roof purlins
Roof has adequate overhang into box gutter / spouting
Roof sheet turned up at high end of roof
Roof sheet turned down at gutter end of roof
Area clean and free of debris
Inspected and accepted by S&H authorised representative as complying with relevant Australian Standard and legislation
Inspected and accepted by Authorized Representative
All items have been completed and demonstrated satisfactorily
Flashings / Cappings: Straight and in correct plane.
Fixed adequately to hold flashing in place and prevent vibration in strong winds.
Silicone sealed under laps and where necessary to make waterproof.
Rivets and fixings sealed where necessary
Area clean and free of debris
Inspected and accepted by S&H authorised representative as complying with relevant Australian Standard and legislation
Inspected and accepted by Authorized Representative
All items have been completed and demonstrated satisfactorily
Roof Batten Support under the Backtray
Penetration: Hole cut to correct size to allow clearance.
Soaker flashing lapped, sealed and fixed correctly.
Adequate support under soaker to prevent ponding.
Side and front aprons / upstands formed to correct size
Adequate support around penetration to prevent roof
Area clean and free of debris
Inspected and accepted by S&H authorised representative as complying with relevant Australian Standard and legislation
Inspected and accepted by Authorized Representative
All items have been completed and demonstrated satisfactorily
